newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Arafat disparages Israel as 'greater Micronesia'.
newsitem.headline: Arafat disparages Israel as 'greater Micronesia'.

text.p: Palestinian President Yasser Arafat, his peace moves with Israel mired in deep crisis, on Saturday referred to the Jewish state as the big brother of the scattered Pacific archipelago of Micronesia.

"The world responded (to new Israeli settlement in Arab East Jerusalem) in the United Nations by a majority of 134 to three countries: Micronesia, greater Micronesia, and America," Arafat said in a speech in the West Bank town of Nablus, counting the countries off on his fingers.

The three nations to vote against an April 25 U.N. General Assembly resolution condemning Israeli Prime Minitser Benjamin Netanyahu's settlement policies were Micronesia, Israel and the United States.
